title: What are JavaScript Data Types?

title: What is the use of isNaN function?
answer_3: isNan function returns true if the argument is not a number; otherwise, it is true
answer_4: isNan function returns true if the argument is not a number; otherwise, it is false
correct_answer: isNan function returns true if the argument is not a number; otherwise, it is false

title: What is negative Infinity?
answer_4: Negative Infinity is a number in JavaScript which can be derived by dividing negative number by zero.
correct_answer: Negative Infinity is a number in JavaScript which can be derived by dividing negative number by zero

title: What is ‘this’ keyword in JavaScript?
answer_1: 'this' keyword refers to the window object
answer_3: ‘This’ keyword refers to the object from where it was called.
